org.jcvlib.core

Class Image

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.jcvlib.core.Image

  • public class Image
extends java.lang.Object
    Main class for all images that used into the JcvLib.

    This image can have 2 types of content:

    • TYPE_8I -- Integer values, that uses 8-bit for save values from interval 0..255.
    • TYPE_64F -- Float-point values, that uses 64-bit for save values from interval [0.0, 255.0].

    Version:
    1.035
    Author:
    Dmitriy Zavodnikov (d.zavodnikov@gmail.com)

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static int EXTRAPLOATION_REFLECT
      Extrapolation type (image boundaries are denoted with '|'): fedcba|abcdefgh|hgfedcb.
      static int EXTRAPLOATION_REPLICATE
      Extrapolation type (image boundaries are denoted with '|'): aaaaaa|abcdefgh|hhhhhhh.
      static int EXTRAPLOATION_WRAP
      Extrapolation type (image boundaries are denoted with '|'): cdefgh|abcdefgh|abcdefg.
      static int EXTRAPLOATION_ZERO
      Extrapolation type (image boundaries are denoted with '|'): 00000|abcdefgh|00000.
      static int INTERPOLATION_BICUBIC
      Bicubic interpolation.
      static int INTERPOLATION_BILINEAR
      Bilinear interpolation.
      static int INTERPOLATION_NEAREST
      Nearest neighbor interpolation.
      static int TYPE_64F
      This image type uses float-point values from interval [0.0, 255.0] for saving image pixels and uses 64-bit for each value.
      static int TYPE_8I
      This image type uses integer values from interval 0..255 for saving image pixels and uses 8-bit for each value.

      • Image

        public Image(int width,
     int height,
     int numOfChannels,
     int type)
        Create new empty image.
        Parameters:
        width - Width of image (in pixels).
        height - Height of image (in pixels).
        numOfChannels - Number of channels in current image.
        type - Type of image. You should use 'Image.TYPE_*' as a parameter!

      • Image

        public Image(int width,
     int height,
     int numOfChannels,
     int type,
     Color initColor)
        Create new image and initialize it by given color.
        Parameters:
        width - Width of image (in pixels).
        height - Height of image (in pixels).
        numOfChannels - Number of channels in current image.
        type - Type of image source. You should use Image.TYPE_* as a parameter!
        initColor - Color to initialize image. Should have same number of channels as current image.

      • Image

        public Image(Image image)
        Create empty image with size, number of channels and source type as in given image.

        Values from given image will be not copied!

      • get

        public double get(int x,
         int y,
         int channel,
         int extrapolationType)
        Extrapolate image uses selected extrapolation type. Uses into filters.
        Parameters:
        x - X-position.
        y - Y-position.
        channel - Number of channel.
        extrapolationType - Type of extrapolation. Use Filters.EXTRAPLOATION_* parameters.
        Returns:
        Values of color from current image using extrapolation. It means, that you can using negative values of x and y or values more than width and height.

      • get

        public double get(double x,
         double y,
         int channel,
         int interpolationType)
        Interpolate image uses selected interpolation type. Uses into geometry transformations.
        Parameters:
        x - X-position.
        y - Y-position.
        channel - Number of channel.
        interpolationType - Type of interpolation. Use Geom.INTERPOLATION_* parameters.
        Returns:
        Values of color from current image using interpolation. It means, that you can using fractional pixel position values of x and y result will be interpolate.

      • copyTo

        public void copyTo(Image target)
        Copy values from current to given image. Given image should have SAME size as current image.

      • copy

        public Image copy()
        Return copy of current image. It will be a REAL COPY of current image or sub-image!

      • getSubimage

        public Image getSubimage(int x,
                int y,
                int width,
                int height)
        Return sub-image based on current source.

        It is NOT COPY current image.

      • getSubimage

        public Image getSubimage(Rectangle subImageRect)
        Return sub-image based on current source. It is NOT COPY current image.

      • getLayer

        public Image getLayer(int startChannel,
             int sizeLayer)
        Select from multichannel image from current image.

        Returned image will be have same size but this new image contains only sizeLayer channels that got from startChannel to startChannel + sizeLayer. It is NOT COPY of current image -- this is SAME channels from current image!

      • getChannel

        public Image getChannel(int numChannel)
        Select single channel image based on channel with number channelNumber from current multichannel image.

        This is analog of split function from other computer vision libraries. You can get access to channels as an elements of a list. It is NOT COPY current image -- this is SAME channel from image!

      • equals

        public boolean equals(java.lang.Object object)
        Return true if current image equivalent to object from parameter and false otherwise.

        Uses JCV.PRECISION_MAX by default.

        Overrides:
        equals in class java.lang.Object

      • equals

        public boolean equals(java.lang.Object object,
             double precision)
        Return true if current image equivalent to object from parameter and false otherwise.
        Parameters:
        object - Object for compare with current image.
        precision - Precision for compare values of pixels.

        public java.lang.String toString()
        Return string with some internal information about this channel.
